Get to know the man behind the DeLorean up close and personal!

The new film Driven untangles the life of the controversial car maker and a new exclusive clip for Mirror Online gives a look at the new biopic.

The film stars The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug star Lee Pace as John DeLorean and Horrible Bosses star Jason Sudeikis as his neighbour, Jim Hoffman.

The official plot synopsis reads: "In an affluent San Diego neighbourhood, former drug- smuggler turned FBI informant Jim Hoffman (Jason Sudeikis) befriends his famous neighbour, motoring engineer and designer John DeLorean (Lee Pace).

"Bedazzled by DeLorean’s charm and vision, Jim soon finds himself in DeLorean’s inner circle at the launch of a new enterprise that promises to revolutionise the American motor industry.

"However, when DeLorean’s dream hits the buffers with his company set to go belly-up, Jim offers the car maker a way out - one that will betray his new friend, please his FBI bosses, and leave the DeLorean dream in the dust."

In addition to Sudeikis and Pace, the film also stars Erin Moriarty and Judy Greer.

The film is currently rated fresh on review aggregator Rotten Tomatoes with a score of 67%, with the critical consensus saying: "Compelling performances from an outstanding cast help Driven take audiences on an enjoyably stranger-than-fiction joyride."

Sounds like it is definitely one for fans of motoring history!

Driven is released in UK cinemas on November 8, 2019.

Will you be seeing Driven in cinemas? Let us know in the comments below.
description: EXCLUSIVE CLIP: Driven stars Lee Pace and Jason Sudeikis in a true story tale of the rise and fall of iconic car maker John DeLorean
